programme.desc: The final word on the day's top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australia's most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: Fault Lines 2022
programme.desc: We thought we'd beaten COVID, until war and economic strife, protest and authoritarianism reminded us how rapidly things can change in a connected world. War, inflation and an unfolding climate crisis sets the scene for 2023.

programme.title: That Pacific Sports Show Ep28
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - Sera Naiqama and Sam Wykes talk all things Pacific Sport with Kiana Takairangi and ABC Grandstand host Andrew Moore. Plus a junior Tongan Rugby player with a big future.

programme.title: Close Of Business Ep45
programme.desc: With cost of living pressures and interest rates rising, it's never been more important to keep an eye on your money. Rachel Pupazzoni and the team explain the economic impact for business and consumers. (Final for 2022)

programme.title: The World This Week Ep47
programme.desc: Beverley O'Connor presents the week's main international news, as reported by ABC News correspondents deployed in Bangkok, Beirut, Istanbul, Jakarta, Jerusalem, London, New Delhi, Port Moresby, Taipei, Tokyo and Washington.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch Ep43
programme.desc: Join Lisa Millar, James Glenday and the team for some of the best conversations as we hear from some of the most informed and entertaining guests who have appeared on News Breakfast.

programme.title: Kurt Fearnley's One Plus One Ep9
programme.desc: Mat Rogers reached the pinnacle representing Australia in rugby league and union, but spent much of his life in his father Steve's shadow. Mat speaks candidly about his mental health struggles and paving his own path.

programme.title: ABC News Regional Ep47
programme.desc: Take a closer look at what's making headlines in regional and rural Australia. ABC News reporters across the country uncover the news and unique stories about what's going on outside the big cities. Presented by Amy Culpitt.

programme.title: Landline Ep4
programme.desc: Too much Landline is never enough! This summer enjoy our best stories from 2022. Demand for carbon offsets from agriculture creates new opportunities for farmers; and in 'Things That Made Australia' our salute to the ute.

programme.title: News Breakfast: Early Ep246
programme.desc: There's always something new to talk about over breakfast. Lisa Millar and James Glenday bring you the latest news and interviews, plus Tony Armstrong with sport, and Stephanie Ferrier with weather.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings Ep241
programme.desc: Ros Childs brings you the top stories of the morning and the latest news as it happens. We cross to ABC News reporters on the scene across Australia and around the globe plus media conferences and analysis from expert guests.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon Ep241
programme.desc: Watch what happens as the day unfolds. Karina Carvalho brings you the top stories, breaking news, original reporting plus the latest details and special guests to keep you informed and up to date on the issues that matter.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Ep36
programme.desc: Sr. 33 - Costa meets an inspiring young reveg expert; Josh propagates woody herbs; Jerry tours an exotic collection; Tammy helps houseplants; Hannah protects fruit trees; we meet a Lebanese chef who grows traditional ingredients.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Rookie Opal Hunters Dan Becker and Justin Lang leave their families behind, risking all to chase an opal fortune. They come across a legendary site known as Shellpatch, will their luck continue or come to a costly end?

programme.title: Escape From The City Ep16
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Sydney newlyweds Will and Briana are looking for a change. On their honeymoon they visited the NSW town of Orange and were smitten with its old-world charm. Can they find a vintage home that suits their growing family?

programme.title: Chopsticks Or Fork? Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - New Bo Wa Restaurant in Moree has been around since the 1970s. Ernest and Whitney Lai are the keeping up the tradition of nourishing the community with Aussie Chinese food like prawn cutlets and fried ice cream.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons Ep5
programme.desc: Gemma Veness brings you all the news of the day and a closer look at the day's top stories from around the nation. Plus interviews with special guests and updates from ABC News reporters on the scene.

programme.title: ABC News Hour Ep241
programme.desc: Gemma Veness brings you all the news of the day and a closer look at the day's top stories from around the nation. Plus interviews with special guests and updates from ABC News reporters on the scene.

programme.title: The Drum Ep226
programme.desc: In this ever-changing world, turn to Ellen Fanning and a panel of informed minds for forthright and insightful conversations on the day's news, big issues, local topics and unique personal insights on the issues that matter.

programme.title: ABC National News Ep241
programme.desc: Australians turn to ABC News when news breaks at home or abroad. Lorna Dunkley presents the day's top stories, latest news and information, exclusive investigations and reports from respected journalists across the nation.

programme.title: 7.30 Ep197
programme.desc: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight Ep246
programme.desc: Lorna Dunkley brings you a clearer picture of the day's top stories with local, national and global news reports. Australia's most trusted news source has the issues and events covered from all angles to keep you in touch.

programme.title: Australian Story Ep1
programme.desc: For Aussie cricket legend Glenn McGrath, honouring the legacy of his much-loved late wife Jane has become a family affair. Featuring interviews with his children, second wife Sara and mate Shane Warne just before he died.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News Ep246
programme.desc: Australia's most trusted source of independent news, ABC News connects all Australians with the latest news, original reporting, reliable information and analysis to keep you informed and up-to-date. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: People's Republic Of Mallacoota Ep5
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Millions of dollars of disaster aid are at risk as the deeply divided residents of bushfire-ravaged Mallacoota struggle to put aside their differences and agree on a recovery plan that will work for the whole community.

programme.title: The World Ep246

programme.desc: French Connections revolves around France, its top stories and news, its experience in various spheres and cultural life, sport events, health care and education, cuisine and so much more. Find out what is like to live in France, get to know its regions, and feel the true taste of France.

programme.title: News
programme.desc: Watch the latest international top stories, The News every 30 minutes with the emphasis on debate, dialogue, role of cultural differences, analytics of key events all over the world, comments, hot topics of the day, reports.

programme.title: Down To Earth
programme.desc: Down To Earth presents people behind fascinating environmental, health and technological innovations in a bid for sustainable solutions to our changing world. The program draws viewers' attention to ecological responsibility and highlights latest solutions to pollution and waste problems all over the world.

They send their photos and videos, which are verified and contextualized by France 24 team of professional journalists in Paris.

programme.title: Encore
programme.desc: Get to know the latest news from the world of art and culture and watch Encore! show on France 24 from Monday to Friday.
